result.markdown:
--- title: "Data Cleaning" author: "Crystal Lewis, Shannon Pileggi, & Peter Higgins" footer: "[Data Cleaning](https://shannonpileggi.github.io/rmedicine-data-cleaning-2023)" logo: "images/R-Med-logo-revised-pride.png" editor: source format: revealjs: theme: slides.scss transition: fade slide-number: true chalkboard: true execute: echo: true freeze: auto cache: true --- # Introduction ::: {.cell} ::: ## Licensing
This work is licensed under [Creative Commons Zero v1.0 Universal](https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/). ## Instructors ::: columns ::: {.column width="33%"} **Crystal Lewis** ![](images/Crystal_circle.png){width="70%"} ::: ::: {.column width="33%"} **Shannon Pileggi** ![](images/Shannon_circle.png){width="70%"} ::: ::: {.column width="33%"} **Peter Higgins** ![](images/Peter_circle.jpg){width="70%"} ::: ::: ## Checklist
``{=html} Install recent R release Current version 4.3.0 ``{=html} Install RStudio I am on version 2022.07.1+554 ``{=html} Install packages ``` r # install.packages(c("gtreg", "gtsummary", "tidyverse", "labelled", "usethis")) ``` ``{=html} Ensure you can knit Rmarkdown files ## Schedule | Time | Activity | |:--------------|:-------------------| | 09:00 - 09:50 | Section 1 | | 09:50 - 10:00 | *Break* | | 10:00 - 10:50 | Section 2 | | 10:50 - 11:00 | *Break* | | 11:00 - 12:00 | Section 3 |
Please add any questions to the public Zoom chat. These may be answered in the moment or addressed at the end depending on context. # Crystal Section A ## Slide 1 ## Slide 2 # Crystal Section B ## Slide 1 ## Slide 2 # Stage 1 cleaning ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-2_454f016262909bcc390718c0b5c5aea0'} ::: ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-3_f2ce1cecded57c226a27faa973d1d7b3'} ::: ## Variable names Original variable names in excel: ![](images/var_names_1.PNG) . . .
Variable names import as shown, with modifications from `readxl::read_excel()` to ensure uniqueness: ![](images/var_names_2.PNG) ## Variable names, cleaner Variable names as imported: ![](images/var_names_2.PNG) . . .
`janitor::clean_names()` removes special characters and implements snake case by default: ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-4_9ff3e3fa7f3315883fb0dc97895ab7ee'} ```{.r .cell-code} df_raw |> janitor::clean_names() ``` ::: ![](images/var_names_3.PNG) ## Remove empty columns or rows ::: panel-tabset ### Problem ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-5_7efac51a2cc9ae7ba4b376ba01ce5f3d'} ```{.r .cell-code} df_raw |> janitor::clean_names() |> select(pat_id, race:start_bp) |> slice(13:18) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 6 √ó 5 pat_id race dob x7 start_bp 1 013 Caucasian 1948-02-27 00:00:00 NA 118/73 2 014 African-American 1966-04-22 00:00:00 NA 106/59 3 015 H/API 1978-08-11 00:00:00 NA 112/69 4 NA NA 5 016 African-American 1998-10-28 00:00:00 NA 114/76 6 017 Caucasian 2001-01-09 00:00:00 NA 124/80 ``` ::: ::: ### Solution ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-6_e6db3b3cc2c2bdf87502b1141e7bedfa'} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="3"} df_raw |> janitor::clean_names() |> janitor::remove_empty(which = c("rows", "cols")) |> select(pat_id, race:start_bp) |> slice(13:18) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 6 √ó 4 pat_id race dob start_bp 1 013 Caucasian 1948-02-27 00:00:00 118/73 2 014 African-American 1966-04-22 00:00:00 106/59 3 015 H/API 1978-08-11 00:00:00 112/69 4 016 African-American 1998-10-28 00:00:00 114/76 5 017 Caucasian 2001-01-09 00:00:00 124/80 6 018 Caucasian 1994-03-07 00:00:00 120/68 ``` ::: ::: ### Confirm ::: columns ::: {.column width="35%"} ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-7_3fa22d26b761567ae301e7df954ac17e'} ```{.r .cell-code} # df_raw |> janitor::clean_names() |> glimpse() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Rows: 31 Columns: 38 $ pat_id "001", "002", "003", "004", "005", "0‚Ä¶ $ treatment "upa", "uste", "oza", "upa", "oza", "‚Ä¶ $ start_date 2021-01-12, 2021-01-19, 2021-02-03, ‚Ä¶ $ ethnic "hispanic", "not hispanic", "not hisp‚Ä¶ $ race "Caucasian", "Caucasian", "African-Am‚Ä¶ $ dob 2005-01-07, 1937-04-13, 1946-06-06, ‚Ä¶ $ x7 NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, N‚Ä¶ $ start_bp "114/72", "132/86", "124/92", "144/83‚Ä¶ $ pre_post_wt_kg "84/82", "77/77", "74/75", "66/65", "‚Ä¶ $ start_mes 3, 2, 1, 3, 3, 346.13164, 305.44946, 341.‚Ä¶ $ end_na 137.4247, 142.4211, 140.1604, 139.473‚Ä¶ $ end_k 3.897774, 4.265951, 4.317939, 3.76078‚Ä¶ $ fake_street "990¬†Mohammad¬†Mountain", "8512¬†O'Conn‚Ä¶ $ fake_city "North¬†Sigmundville", "Port¬†Halstad",‚Ä¶ $ fake_state "New¬†Mexico", "Missouri", "South¬†Caro‚Ä¶ $ fake_zip 96074, 11264, 57246, 31457, 30711, 52‚Ä¶ ``` ::: ::: ::: ::: {.column width="65%"} ::: glimpse() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Rows: 30 Columns: 37 $ pat_id "001", "002", "003", "004", "005", "0‚Ä¶ $ treatment "upa", "uste", "oza", "upa", "oza", "‚Ä¶ $ start_date 2021-01-12, 2021-01-19, 2021-02-03, ‚Ä¶ $ ethnic "hispanic", "not hispanic", "not hisp‚Ä¶ $ race "Caucasian", "Caucasian", "African-Am‚Ä¶ $ dob 2005-01-07, 1937-04-13, 1946-06-06, ‚Ä¶ $ start_bp "114/72", "132/86", "124/92", "144/83‚Ä¶ $ pre_post_wt_kg "84/82", "77/77", "74/75", "66/65", "‚Ä¶ $ start_mes 3, 2, 1, 3, 3, 2, 3, 3, 2, 3, 3, 3, 3‚Ä¶ $ start_bss 78.06060, 54.27825, 26.51270, "6.4360061166151254", "33.73708089887‚Ä¶ $ end_wbc 9.211441, 10.415671, 3.000000, 4.9051‚Ä¶ $ end_plt 228.61315, 346.13164, 305.44946, 341.‚Ä¶ $ end_na 137.4247, 142.4211, 140.1604, 139.473‚Ä¶ $ end_k 3.897774, 4.265951, 4.317939, 3.76078‚Ä¶ $ fake_street "990¬†Mohammad¬†Mountain", "8512¬†O'Conn‚Ä¶ $ fake_city "North¬†Sigmundville", "Port¬†Halstad",‚Ä¶ $ fake_state "New¬†Mexico", "Missouri", "South¬†Caro‚Ä¶ $ fake_zip 96074, 11264, 57246, 31457, 30711, 52‚Ä¶ ``` ::: ::: ::: ::: ::: ## Recoding ::: panel-tabset ### Problem ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-9_e5ad79b60d43e562724cb2ac38cc24d8'} ```{.r .cell-code} df_clean <- df_raw |> janitor::clean_names() |> janitor::remove_empty(which = c("rows", "cols")) df_clean |> count(ethnic) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 5 √ó 2 ethnic n 1 Hispanic 1 2 NOT hispanic 1 3 hispamnic 1 4 hispanic 3 5 not hispanic 24 ``` ::: ::: ### Solution ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-10_f74a579c12e2fb265e6c5748f82e3544'} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="4-9"} df_clean <- df_raw |> janitor::clean_names() |> janitor::remove_empty(which = c("rows", "cols")) |> mutate( ethnic_clean = case_when( ethnic %in% c("hispanic", "Hispanic", "hispamnic") ~ "hispanic", ethnic %in% c("NOT hispanic", "not hispanic") ~ "not hispanic", ) ) df_clean |> count(ethnic_clean) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 2 √ó 2 ethnic_clean n 1 hispanic 5 2 not hispanic 25 ``` ::: ::: ### Confirm ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-11_e02736055b5804c79e7337654a89d998'} ```{.r .cell-code} df_clean |> count(ethnic_clean, ethnic) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 5 √ó 3 ethnic_clean ethnic n 1 hispanic Hispanic 1 2 hispanic hispamnic 1 3 hispanic hispanic 3 4 not hispanic NOT hispanic 1 5 not hispanic not hispanic 24 ``` ::: ::: ::: ## Replace values with missing ::: panel-tabset ### Problem ::: columns ::: {.column width="50%"} ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-12_753c87ded3559dbb8b59ef8ad57ba460'} ```{.r .cell-code} df_clean |> count(end_na) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 30 √ó 2 end_na n 1 -99 1 2 133. 1 3 135. 1 4 135. 1 5 136. 1 6 136. 1 7 137. 1 8 137. 1 9 138. 1 10 138. 1 # ‚Ñπ 20 more rows ``` ::: ::: ::: ::: {.column width="50%"} ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-13_dadd6d4a90536ac9572339b0a1618965'} ```{.r .cell-code} df_clean |> ggplot(aes(x = end_na)) + geom_histogram() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](index_files/figure-revealjs/unnamed-chunk-13-1.png){width=960} ::: ::: ::: ::: ### Solution ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-14_0e65c233a13f7039616660e6cfcc0924'} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="9"} df_clean <- df_raw |> janitor::clean_names() |> janitor::remove_empty(which = c("rows", "cols")) |> mutate( ethnic_clean = case_when( ethnic %in% c("hispanic", "Hispanic", "hispamnic") ~ "hispanic", ethnic %in% c("NOT hispanic", "not hispanic") ~ "not hispanic", ), end_na_clean = na_if(end_na, -99) ) ``` ::: ### Confirm ::: columns ::: {.column width="50%"} ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-15_ef2fd497823e25f0bafcd46b41f21117'} ```{.r .cell-code} df_clean |> count(end_na, end_na_clean) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 30 √ó 3 end_na end_na_clean n 1 -99 NA 1 2 133. 133. 1 3 135. 135. 1 4 135. 135. 1 5 136. 136. 1 6 136. 136. 1 7 137. 137. 1 8 137. 137. 1 9 138. 138. 1 10 138. 138. 1 # ‚Ñπ 20 more rows ``` ::: ::: ::: ::: {.column width="50%"} ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-16_2b4cb4a2f3bd339714b768ca47fb97b3'} ```{.r .cell-code} df_clean |> ggplot(aes(x = end_na_clean)) + geom_histogram() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](index_files/figure-revealjs/unnamed-chunk-16-1.png){width=960} ::: ::: ::: ::: ::: ## Incorrect variable type ::: panel-tabset ### Problem ::: columns ::: {.column width="50%"} ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-17_5d9f1bd7056f98a4792fa00def934b63'} ```{.r .cell-code} df_raw |> select(end_emo) |> glimpse() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Rows: 31 Columns: 1 $ end_emo "30.275122309944972", "37.118259536333433", "37.07574416254249‚Ä¶ ``` ::: :::
::: {.fragment} ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-18_04c3e5058aed310ea1bf179e24a595a4'} ```{.r .cell-code} mean(df_raw[["end_emo"]]) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] NA ``` ::: ::: ::: ::: ::: {.column width="50%" .fragment} ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/revealjs/unnamed-chunk-19_a7a742d308b38f624ebee573df23d2c4'} ```{.r .cell-code} df_raw[["end_emo"]] ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] "30.275122309944972" "37.118259536333433" "37.075744162542499" [4] "44.923425798503175" "63.228299525683681" "41.86435199805284" [7] "67.32031128387257" "59.876061196366294" "23.18900885212669" [10] "41.504922743680069" "30.592724281914979" "46.630283339296213" [13] "50.615682540772333" "65.526626277741144" "not done" [16] NA "41.49300761007953" "37.159835881588052" [19] "65.952234027837804" "14.484200057523021" "57.241869748195107" [22] "42.544433076049309" "38.365858773417663" "69.372774009714519" [25] "48.314764900684409" "48.030380025050185" "39.109462231952456" [28] "38.28942618055703" "65.298322247205732" "28.551119718792652" [31] "36.381974110703389" ``` ::: ::: ::: ::: ### Solution ### Confirm ::: # Wrangling your Data ## Deciding on the Unit of Observation Image ## Is it the Patient? - Patient over time - Outcome colectomy - labs over time ## Is it the Visit/Encounter? - Patient over time - Outcome colectomy - labs over time ## Reshaping your data with tidyr ## Pivoting Longer (common) - Visit Dates/Measures - Your Turn (Exercise) ## Pivoting Wider # Filling in Unobserved Dates/Times with padr ## Padding unobserved dates (weekends?) ## Padding unovserved times ## Joins of data from different sources ## Local Demographics with CDC SVI data (one to one) ## Patient Demographics with Lab results (one to many) ## Thank you! üôè [Click here to submit workshop feedback](https://forms.gle/kvEirN7sJmavem8q6){target="_blank"}

include-after-body:
<script>
  // htmlwidgets need to know to resize themselves when slides are shown/hidden.
  // Fire the "slideenter" event (handled by htmlwidgets.js) when the current
  // slide changes (different for each slide format).
  (function () {
    // dispatch for htmlwidgets
    function fireSlideEnter() {
      const event = window.document.createEvent("Event");
      event.initEvent("slideenter", true, true);
      window.document.dispatchEvent(event);
    }

    function fireSlideChanged(previousSlide, currentSlide) {
      fireSlideEnter();

      // dispatch for shiny
      if (window.jQuery) {
        if (previousSlide) {
          window.jQuery(previousSlide).trigger("hidden");
        }
        if (currentSlide) {
          window.jQuery(currentSlide).trigger("shown");
        }
      }
    }

    // hookup for slidy
    if (window.w3c_slidy) {
      window.w3c_slidy.add_observer(function (slide_num) {
        // slide_num starts at position 1
        fireSlideChanged(null, w3c_slidy.slides[slide_num - 1]);
      });
    }

  })();
</script>
